availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: I, James Ross Snowden, Prothonotary of the Supreme Court of Pennslyvania, in and for the Eastern District, do certify -- That the H. John M. Read, by whom the foregoing Certificate was made and given, was at the time of making and giving the same, and now is a Justice of the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania, to whose acts as such, full faith and credit are and ought to be given, as well in Court of Judicature as elsewhere, and that his signature thereto is genuine
I witness whereof I have hereunto set my Hand and Seal of said Supreme Court this 16th day of August A D. 1865.

Comr Deeds
Oaths of Chas H. T. Collis
filed 21 Aug 1865

State of Pennsylvania
County of Philadelphia } SS.

I Charles H. T. Collis Esqr, Attorney at Law, being duly appointed by the Governor of Kentucky, a Commissioner of the State of Kentucky, resident at Philadelphia in the State of Pennsylvania, do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of my station.

Charles H. T. Collis
Commissioner of Kentucky for the State of Penna. --
CHARLES H. T. COLLIS.
COMMISSIONER
PHILADELPHIA. PA:
Sworn and Subscribed before me this fifteenth day of August A.D. 1865

John M. Read
Justice of Sup. Court.
